intro: Palicourea quinquepyrena, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The fruit is a small, spherical drupe that contains a single seed.
